content.en: Animal behavior classification: Scientists have been exploring the use of machine learning algorithms to classify animal behavior based on data collected from sensors and observations. These algorithms, such as Support Vector Machines, Hidden-Markov Models, and k-nearest neighbor, can automatically analyze accelerometer data and other measurements to identify specific behaviors. By using these algorithms, researchers hope to gain insights into the behaviors of animals in their natural habitats and improve our understanding of their daily lives.
content.da: Klassificering af dyreadfærd: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af maskinlæringsalgoritmer til at klassificere dyreadfærd baseret på data indsamlet fra sensorer og observationer. Disse algoritmer, såsom Support Vector Machines, Hidden-Markov Modeller og k-nearest neighbor, kan automatisk analysere accelerometerdata og andre målinger for at identificere specifikke adfærdsmønstre. Ved at bruge disse algoritmer håber forskerne at få indsigt i dyrenes adfærd i deres naturlige habitater og forbedre vores forståelse af deres daglige liv.
